reviews.review_msg: Fun lectures, but lacks clarity for assignments-- this evidently dropped my grade because he didn't explain what he is looking for even when I asked. He also never explained about his "quiz" portion of the class, nor did he say when they'll be up. Syllabus says quizzes are 24 hours long, but they're until midnight the same day.

Good instructor who obviously wants his students to do well. Likes Paris and history a whole lot, and has good stories to tell about the city that help you better understand, well, a whole lot of stuff. The class, the topic and the books seemed pretty intimidating at first, but the whole thing was pretty easy thanks to Michael.
Hardest class I have taken but I learn a lot.

One of the nicest profs Ive ever met. Always available to help, and wants to see you succeed. Grades a little too tough based on the scope of the course (an elective), but makes classes fly by with engaging activities. Overall great prof.

Taking Prof. O'Brien's class was a real treat. She always made the 3.5-4hr lectures fly by with constant engagement and an open-forum-style lecture. Coming from a heavy science background, I can say that her class is the epitome of what I wish all of my electives were. Ask her for support when you need it and she will ALWAYS be willing to help.
